column1: Like many my family adapted our Thanksgiving plans this year to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 and stay healthy. We miss in-person visits with family and friends but these precautions are important. https://t.co/GLZOLlVpcS

We should be working together to expand - not end - financial COVID relief programs for small businesses. Small biz closures could become permanent if the Trump admin ends the Main Street Lending Program & other efforts that a support #smallbusinesses. https://t.co/B20kjrhWUy
We won’t control COVID unless people can stay home. We need to pass a bill for monthly direct payments during the pandemic. https://t.co/UvV5v6YFwi

The Senate should not block funding that families and others desperately need especially as COVID cases soar and hospitals overflow. I again call on @senatemajldr to bring the Heroes Act or updated Heroes Act to the Senate floor for a vote.

The House passed the Heroes Act 6+ months ago to help stop the spread of COVID-19 and ease unexpected financial hardships but the Senate has failed to act. We updated the legislation in October to meet the country’s urgent needs but the Senate hasn’t passed that bill either.

COVID cases and hospitalizations in Oregon are surging quickly and we must work together to stop the spread. Please keep our communities and frontline workers safe by taking this freeze seriously.   https://t.co/BGCxJ9D7hr

COVID-19 is spreading rapidly in Oregon and hospitalizations are increasing. Until we have a vaccine the only way to contain the virus is for all of us to closely follow every public health guideline.  https://t.co/ODWTfkA958

Thank you to the Oregon leaders who spent time talking with me about their challenges and ideas for rebuilding in the days and months ahead. I'll keep fighting for more COVID relief for arts and culture organizations-- and everyone. https://t.co/z0kHyIcUXj

I met with representatives from the Small Business Recovery Center @AdelanteMujeres a small business owner who benefitted from their services and officials from Washington County to discuss challenges and opportunities facing small businesses during the COVID pandemic. https://t.co/NtJjTcF1qp

The Trump Administration is reportedly planning to withhold nearly $2 million in funding for community and migrant health centers that provide critical services during the coronavirus crisis to people in Multnomah County. https://t.co/stD2IBT5Av

Pacific Islanders have the highest COVID infection rates of any group in OR. I appreciate the hard work of the Oregon #PacificIslander Coalition to speak up behalf of this diverse community & I’ll keep working to address the longstanding inequities highlighted by the pandemic. https://t.co/wHKvATJnIh

This #PPP report from @COVIDOversight shows troubling evidence that the Administration neglected underserved small business owners especially women & people of color. Wealthier applicants got loans faster which caused longer waits & reduced funding for truly #smallbusinesses. https://t.co/ehQuMfLvab

The House passed an updated Heroes Act last week to help our state and local governments respond to this ongoing health crisis. The bill includes more funding for the testing we need to get COVID under control.

Oregon reported a record number of COVID-19 cases yesterday. Please take this seriously! Wear a mask maintain physical distance & avoid large gatherings. There are many people working to keep our community safe & I appreciate them & their efforts. We can’t let our guard down.

For too many people life at home is not safe. COVID has made things worse for those experiencing domestic violence. As a mom and a policy maker I'm working to keep our kids families and communities safe.
Since the outset of this pandemic we have consistently seen that members of our Latinx & BIPOC communities -- many working on the frontlines -- have been disproportionately affected by COVID-19.

My Oregon colleagues and I sent this letter urging @stevenmnuchin1 & the IRS to extend the deadline to help Oregonians who are working to rebuild from wildfires & recover from #covid19. I will continue fighting in DC to get assistance to our communities. https://t.co/NgCfiyJDZc
My thoughts are with Pres. Trump & @FLOTUS along with the hundreds of thousands of families and individuals across our country who have been affected by COVID-19 and I wish them a speedy recovery.

Cuando escuché que los líderes comunitarios no tenían suficiente información sobre un brote importante de COVID en el condado de Clatsop le pedí a la @OHAOregon y a Pacific Seafood que convoquen una reunión virtual para ayudar a responder las preguntas de la comunidad.

When I heard that community leaders didn’t have enough information about a major COVID outbreak in Clatsop County I asked Oregon Health Authority and Pacific Seafood to convene a virtual town hall meeting to help answer the community’s questions.
As the coronavirus death toll tragically surpasses 200000 and the pandemic continues to devastate our communities and economy the American people need relief.

Wildfires surged across my home state of Oregon at unprecedented rates this year & many experts are predicting significant flooding & landslides this winter. At today's @HouseScience hearing I called for robust emergency preparedness esp during #COVID19. https://t.co/f8ozJ7fJ01

Birth control is a health care necessity yet too many people still face barriers to access. These obstacles have grown during the #COVID19 pandemic as economic disparities have deepened. We must #FreeThePill. #WorldContraceptionDay https://t.co/xLB3Th5xTz

As the coronavirus pandemic continues millions of children have been at risk of going hungry. I’m working to protect access to nutrition programs amid closures & I’m glad I could help the House pass a funding deal that will preserve and expand food assistance.
First COVID and now wildfires have taken a severe toll on the Oregon economy. This year my office has worked w/ more than 400 business owners to connect them to resources & answer their questions.
Oregonians and Americans need help fighting COVID-19 not angry missives that are designed to create fear and further divide our country.
This week the US is expected to surpass 200000 COVID-19 deaths and cases are continuing to spike in many places around the country.

FEMA should reduce the cost-sharing requirement for 2020 disasters to alleviate the strain and cover all COVID-19 disaster costs. We cannot cut corners as we strive to help people and communities who have lost everything.
COVID-19 has strained budgets at every level leaving our cities counties and state with few resources to respond to the most devastating fires we've seen in decades.  https://t.co/955pc8VPvh

I’m grateful the House passed the 21st Century Community Leaning Centers Coronavirus Relief Act to provide desperately needed flexibility that will help more low-income school aged children continue their education in safe and supportive academic environments.

The ongoing coronavirus pandemic has been extremely challenging for working parents forcing them to navigate new remote learning programs and search for child care while still working to support their families. https://t.co/pfA0tfYusu
Heading back to DC to continue the fight for #Covid19 relief and more support for Oregonians affected by the wildfires. https://t.co/cAWB0Gaue2

As cash-strapped schools face unprecedented challenges related to COVID-19 the Department is threatening to withhold federal funding to coerce schools into actions that will harm transgender students.

There is no appropriate time for the federal government to erect barriers to justice for survivors of sexual assault but the administration’s decision to finalize DeVos' rewrite of the #TitleIX rule in the middle of the COVID-19 pandemic was a stunning display of callousness.

Please do what you can to protect your health - especially important during #COVID19. 🔥limit exposure to smoke by staying indoors when possible 🗺️ remain informed on conditions & plan ahead ☎️ if you have a medical emergency call 911 immediately More: https://t.co/YEsT0EOEYX

As we celebrate Labor Day weekend please continue to practice physical distancing wear a mask and be cautious in making plans. Keeping our community safe and minimizing the spread of COVID-19 requires small sacrifices that benefit all. https://t.co/Lqcc95GCuO

The coronavirus pandemic has increased isolation & financial need making seniors even more vulnerable to fraud or abuse. I joined @RonWyden & a group of advocates today to discuss our bill to provide robust funding for vital programs that protect seniors.

Another month’s rent will be due tomorrow for millions of Americans who are struggling to make ends meet. The coronavirus pandemic has killed over 180000 people in the United States and left millions out of work.   https://t.co/nqxFA0xcXt

Far too many seniors have experienced abuse and neglect and the coronavirus pandemic has increased isolation and put even more people at risk. As Co-Chair of the House Elder Justice Caucus I will continue fighting for this important update to the Elder Justice Act.
It has been more than 3 months since the House passed the #HeroesAct to provide desperately needed relief in response to the coronavirus pandemic. People need help NOW.   https://t.co/JVp7t6i0Ys

Before COVID-19 our public schools were serving meals to more than 29 million students; nearly 22 million of those students received free or reduced-price lunches. My bill will make sure all students receive meals without cost throughout the pandemic.  https://t.co/v3X0qbAXE3

When #COVID19 closed school buildings many AAPI students who relied on school lunch & breakfast faced hunger. The Census affects $8.7 BILLION for school meals. Get counted to help students for the next 10 years: https://t.co/KCbB1yCaGC #AAPI2020 #2020Census https://t.co/cGqyMa4Rle

Did you know that women make up 52% of essential workers during #COVID19?  And Women of Color - including Latinas - are the most likely to work in low-wage jobs where they are being shortchanged by a combined gender and racial wage gap.   We need #HealthEquity for Women of Color. https://t.co/NhDltmRNOs

As we celebrate 55 years of the Voting Rights Act our work to ensure access to the ballot isn’t over. Congress must pass the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Act and we must give states the resources they need to #ProtectOurVote amid the COVID-19 crisis. #VRA55 https://t.co/RH8GaJ9fBz

Community health centers like @VirginiaGarcia Memorial Health Center are working around the clock to keep people healthy and safe during the #COVID19 pandemic. Thank you to their dedicated staff for caring for our community! #NationalHealthCenterWeek https://t.co/mwDtjry8Ph

It's unconscionable that the Senate has adjourned & gone home. People in Oregon and across the country are anxious & stressed as unemployment benefits run out & housing protections end for many. Bills are due and people are still not back to work because the coronavirus is raging https://t.co/F5ZlrsaeGY

advanced parole applications meaning folks like Tania will not be able to have the basic right of saying goodbye to their loved ones.   The Trump admin must stop focusing on attacking the immigrant community and instead focus on our real enemy: COVID-19. #HomeisHere
The Child Care Is Essential Act will provide immediate relief through $50 billion which is less than the amount that went to the nation’s airlines in coronavirus legislation. https://t.co/3XLSqvgGq4

👦🏻 $1.5 billion increase for #ChildNutrition programs and language to extend the nationwide waivers included in my bipartisan ‘COVID-19 Child Nutrition Response Act’ so children can continue to access nutrition when schools are closed
🏥 $10.02 billion in emergency funding for coronavirus preparedness response and relief globally

At a time when our communities are struggling with #COVID19 & there is heightened awareness about injustices in our society - including inequitable access to our wild places - our bill to #FundLWCF will boost rural economies & expand access to #PublicLands for future generations. https://t.co/zYBMkDvmsR

As cases of #COVID19 begin to surge again in our communities we need to protect workers from hazardous conditions on the job. I'm calling on the Senate to pass the Heroes Act which includes investments in workplace protections & personal protective equipment for workers.
Mr. President - You could "help" by sending more PPE and COVID-19 tests not stormtroopers. https://t.co/spOPnnS6Hz

Millions of people are unemployed through no fault of their own because of #COVID19 & are at risk of losing their federal unemployment benefits on July 31st. I joined my colleagues in calling on President Trump & the Senate to take action immediately and pass the #HeroesAct. https://t.co/R07diphFXp

As Chair of @EdLaborCmte's Civil Rights and Human Services Subcommittee I led 77 of my colleagues in calling for more funding for LIHEAP the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/n6KK1VNeml

The COVID-19 pandemic has created stress for families across our country and many have to decide whether to pay their energy bills or buy food and medication. Keeping the lights on and the water running is more important than ever in a pandemic. https://t.co/FfvmsKMpZt
We are months into the #COVID19 pandemic and I know how frustrating it is to have neither unemployment benefits nor the information you need about how to get them.

Yesterday @HouseScience discussed how Black Indigenous & communities of color have been the hardest hit by the #COVID19 pandemic & are also disproportionately affected by the #ClimateCrisis. Our @ClimateCrisis Action Plan takes steps to repair the legacy of environmental racism https://t.co/iDWpi1UFRB

We must act now save our child care system. Join me for a discussion this Friday at 10 a.m. PDT about child care during the COVID-19 pandemic and after and what we can do to support families children providers and workers. https://t.co/WykvKvcql0
Our public education system faced serious challenges in Oregon and across the country before COVID-19 and the pandemic has exacerbated inequities and widened the achievement gap.

The Trump administration should be focused on containing COVID-19 not threatening international students with deportation in a blatant attempt to force in-person classes despite local health considerations. https://t.co/PWv8spyOgd

The administration needs to focus on combating the real enemy -- COVID-19 -- rather than perpetuating Stephen Miller's white supremacist ideals and mean-spirited policies which are hurting our communities students and agencies.

Instead of coordinating a national testing strategy or helping struggling Americans who lost their jobs because of COVID-19 the Trump administration is exploiting the pandemic to punish immigrants and expand Stephen Miller's xenophobic immigration policies.

Withdrawing from the World Health Organization in the middle of a global pandemic is irresponsible & dangerous. Trump & his administration have already failed to contain the coronavirus -- this decision could put more lives at risk by limiting our access to research and equipment https://t.co/ol8IRHKPJS
Instead the Trump admin showed a dangerous lack of leadership. Now COVID is spreading fast and we're still unprepared. Trump and his administration failed to act. https://t.co/9uzsMNM5Vl

Each of us made tremendous sacrifices to slow the spread of #COVID. Millions of people lost their livelihoods. These sacrifices were supposed to give us time to prepare to increase testing and to build up our health system.

@SenWarren @SteveDaines @RepJimBanks This is even more important now as more workers face unstable employment and reduced benefits because of COVID-19. Also young workers Black workers and workers of color face additional employment barriers and job discrimination that make them more likely to change jobs.

The coronavirus pandemic has been devastating for those w/ underlying conditions disproportionately harming Black & Latinx people & communities of color. We should be doing all we can to expand access to affordable health care for everyone – not take it away. #LowerCostsForCare

Before COVID-19 it was already extremely difficult to find affordable child care in Oregon. @CAPEarlyEd’s latest report confirms what I have heard while talking with parents child care providers and workers – the pandemic has made things much worse. https://t.co/zo8DoJl12K

Many workers in coastal communities were struggling even before COVID-19 devastated their economies. They need our support now and by investing in our ocean and coastal recovery efforts we can provide a vital lifeline that creates good-paying jobs.

Now with COVID child care providers are struggling to cover operating expenses and may face permanent closure as states require them to shut down or limit their enrollment to the children of first responders and essential workers to protect public health. https://t.co/IMeWZuLA0B

Before COVID we had a #ChildCareCrisis with three main problems: vast unmet need high cost for families and insufficient compensation and benefits for early childhood educators. https://t.co/tNHaTIBLE6

It’s been challenging for Oregonians to navigate the unemployment system during #COVID19 and I called on @ORemployment to host public webinars to explain eligibility. OED just announced its first webinar at 10am today. Register below. https://t.co/Tyr818U6zl
My #WorldOceansDay webinar on how we can turn the tide and help our coastal communities recover from the #COVID19 pandemic is starting now. Tune in here: https://t.co/gO2VNSnWce

Our coastal communities are struggling during the #COVID19 pandemic but with federal investments we can help revitalize our blue economy. Join me on Monday June 8th at 2pm for a #WorldOceansDay discussion about how to turn the tide. RSVP here: https://t.co/dp00nQqO0v https://t.co/aZz9TCKXkG

Tear gas is banned in international warfare. It causes respiratory damage which is especially dangerous and harmful during the coronavirus pandemic. Yet police are using it indiscriminately often on peaceful protesters.    https://t.co/SuGQNBqiqB
Breonna was an essential worker -- an EMT who was on the frontlines helping others during the coronavirus pandemic. She was a daughter a niece a friend and a beloved member of her community.

More than 100000 lives have been lost to #COVID-19. Today we hold a national #DayOfMourning to remember the family members friends first responders and others who have died. And we recommit to advancing the testing and other resources we need to keep our communities safe. https://t.co/xFrXFtnOEr
Unemployment benefits are a lifeline for working families who were already on the edge before #COVID19 & are now facing incredible financial hardship as the pandemic upends our communities.

.@USDA is now accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program to provide assistance to farmers who are facing market disruptions and price declines because of the effects of the #COVID19 pandemic.

Planned Parenthood health centers qualify for certain #COVID19 relief programs & I'm deeply concerned the Trump admin & others are wrongfully targeting & threatening them. I joined my colleagues in calling on SBA & Treasury to carry out these programs as Congress intended. https://t.co/AxLm5tQowt

It's unacceptable @OSHA_DOL & @NIOSH are not upholding their obligation to keep workers safe during #COVID19. I will keep fighting for an emergency workplace standard to protect the health & safety of the essential workers who are sustaining our communities during this pandemic. https://t.co/nRycxp0J3l

1 in 4 workers - more than 40 million people - have filed for unemployment benefits since the beginning of the #COVID19 pandemic.   I'm calling on the Senate to pass the #HeroesAct with expanded unemployment direct payments & more to support workers.   https://t.co/FpuYIgxa9f

100000 people have now lost their lives to COVID-19 including more than 140 Oregonians. This deeply tragic milestone represents an incalculable loss to our communities. We must remember those who died as we strive to prevent further spread.   https://t.co/v4W2GhMQs3

As we prepare for this wildfire season resources & personnel are stretched thin because of #COVID19. I joined @RepPeterDeFazio @repblumenauer & @repgregwalden in calling on @forestservice to show us its plan for addressing these challenges in Oregon. https://t.co/xhhALJCYwk
Too many families and individuals across the country are already struggling to pay their bills because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Among them are doctors nurses caregivers grocery clerks and so much more. The Senate must help the hardest hit communities by passing the #HeroesAct. I will continue to fight for funding that is equitable and inclusive. #COVID19 does not discriminate and neither should relief
There are community members who need our help. Now more than ever we must all come together to fight #COVID19. #WereAllInThisTogether #sipuedemosjuntos
I recently met with Latinx community leaders to discuss the alarming statistics about COVID-19 infection rates among the Latinx community in Washington County.

.@nytimes reaffirmed what we already knew: communities of color fighting #COVID19 are dealing w/ compounded risks: under or uninsured healthcare barriers to secure housing & resources immigration status high-exposure jobs & institutional discrimination https://t.co/lEuWezdYTw

I’ve joined @davidcicilline in calling on Secretary Mnuchin to provide Social Security and VA recipients the stimulus payments they are due before 2021. Congress intended these payments to be immediate relief for Americans fighting COVID-19. https://t.co/h3fyJSfcyL

I’ve heard from many business owners about how difficult things are as the COVID-19 pandemic continues to upturn our daily lives and disrupt our plans for the future. Your feedback plays an important role in guiding my work to secure additional flexibility and support.

I joined my @ClimateCrisis colleagues & @WCraigFugate to discuss the importance of federal & state coordination to rapidly contain and suppress wildfires during #COVID19. Recent @NIFCfire outlook suggests that we could face an intense wildfire season & we must be prepared. https://t.co/Fi1pLh4oOk

We need a robust response to the economic consequences of #COVID19. Leaders from our local workforce systems in NW Oregon recognize this & many of them joined @SkillsCoalition and me to discuss potential rapid response activities that will support workers https://t.co/Q5zswR1eVE

There’s still time to participate in my survey about your experiences with employment child care and more during COVID-19. I appreciate the time thousands of you have already taken to help me help you. https://t.co/DzV3YNQNVV

Oregon’s hospitals are essential to keeping our communities healthy and always there for us in times of need. This #HospitalWeek I’m especially grateful for our #healthcareheroes’ tireless service and the sacrifices they are making to fight COVID-19. https://t.co/9hMIsbO8D0

As the coronavirus pandemic continues many people find themselves in need of food assistance for the 1st time. @OregonDHS launched a new guide in 11 languages to help navigate school meal programs food banks meals for seniors and more. https://t.co/vHyE9J2ols

I’m fighting in Congress to make sure you have access to the relief you need to survive the coronavirus pandemic. If you live in Oregon's 1st District please take a moment to complete this short survey to help me help you. https://t.co/DzV3YNQNVV

This is a good first step but not enough to address the extent of the devastation this pandemic has caused. I support ongoing payments during the pandemic. We must put #PeopleFirst in future relief so the American people can deal with the daily challenges of fighting #COVID-19.

Thank you to everyone who joined my webinar last week with @ORDOJ and the Oregon Law Center on the protections that are available to families workers and individuals during COVID-19. If you missed it you can still watch here: https://t.co/Lukhb9JzYl

Congratulations to @NSF on its 70th anniversary! The scientific research NSF supports has benefitted us all throughout the past seven decades and will continue to do so into the future as the NSF works to address COVID-19 and more.
I'm calling on House Leadership to provide $1.5b in direct assistance to Tribal subsistence & commercial fisheries & $2b to bolster the domestic seafood supply chain in the next #COVID19 package.

The devastating April #JobsReport reveals the magnitude of the economic consequences of #COVID19. People in Oregon and across the country are hurting and the scale of this crisis demands immediate action. https://t.co/2h2nIjYnk5

In Oregon Hispanic individuals comprise 13.3% of the total population but 29.1% of confirmed cases. And in Washington County nearly 60% of the county's Hispanic or Latinx community members who tested positive for COVID-19 are frontline workers.

We must do more to address the disproportionate effect of COVID-19 on Latinx communities. I'm leading members of our Oregon Congressional delegation in calling for the next coronavirus response package to include support for those who have been left behind https://t.co/srGEoJNSB3 https://t.co/Vm8mV6IeqN

LIVE NOW: Join my webinar with @ORDOJ and the Oregon Law Center on the protections that are available to you during COVID-19. We're talking about housing direct payments benefits and more. https://t.co/jd5MgJPJCe

Please join @ORDOJ the Oregon Law Center and me for a webinar tomorrow about the resources that are available to help protect consumers during COVID-19. We’ll talk about housing direct payments resources to address domestic violence and more. https://t.co/wJGAVDWw8d https://t.co/wD2QCiS8k4

I have consistently opposed Sec. DeVos' attempts to undermine Title IX protections and I joined with several colleagues last month to express the additional dangers this plan will create during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/qs4idkm5DB

An investment of $50 billion in the next COVID-19 relief package would be an important start to help meet current child care needs for families provide economic security for child care businesses and support child care workers.
The coronavirus crisis has hit the child care system especially hard causing widespread layoffs and mandatory closures. https://t.co/nbauRqHuYj

When families can go back to work the economic crisis won’t end if they don’t have access to child care. I’m continuing to fight for $50 billion in next COVID-19 relief package to address the specific child care needs in Oregon and around the country.   https://t.co/JbGcYkERdz
Please join me for a webinar this Thursday about the resources that are available to help protect consumers during COVID-19. https://t.co/bbGOMQmVEV

During the #COVID19 outbreak some companies & individuals are using deceptive practices to take advantage of consumers by price gouging. In Oregon we are fortunate to have laws that can level the playing field.

I’m proud to lead the issue in Congress by calling for urgent and significant relief to the child care sector of $50 billion for providers families and child care workers in the next coronavirus response package.  https://t.co/x0mER279wa

As we respond to the coronavirus pandemic we cannot forget about the bravery of survivors who have come forward and exposed the pervasive nature of sexual harassment and assault in the workplace. https://t.co/wy6Ogw5f5s

We are facing a severe worker safety crisis. Workers on the frontlines of #COVID19 lack access the workplace protections needed to stay safe. On #WorkersMemorialDay we honor the workers who have died on the job and recommit to fighting for robust workplace safety standards.

As our communities face the coronavirus pandemic many people have stepped up to serve others. I’m grateful for @ChineseOregon’s donations and I’m glad I could help the personal protective equipment arrive safely from overseas. https://t.co/av1uH0PbGy

In Oregon the average age of Dreamers when they arrived in the US is 7 years old. This is their home; they have grown up here and continue to contribute and help to protect the health and safety of Americans - especially as we look to defeat COVID-19.
The nonpartisan @amprog found that 202500 DACA recipients are working on the frontlines of #COVID19 https://t.co/YKdSCNaVKJ

Any day now the Supreme Court could rule on President Trump’s plan to end #DACA. This decision by the administration is heartless and if upheld would be catastrophic for America’s efforts in fighting #COVID19.
Today – as the pandemic continues to ravage communities and our economy remains largely shut down – we address their urgent concerns. https://t.co/XsPfhvgzp0 #CoronavirusRelief

Today I’m back in DC to vote for critical funding our small businesses and health care providers need right now and for more testing. It’s important but not enough. I’ll keep advocating until NW Oregonians have the support they need. I am here for you. #CoronavirusRelief https://t.co/UhxSRB3L6Q

Essential workers need workplace standards to protect their health & well-being especially during #COVID19. I've joined my @EdLaborCmte colleagues in introducing the COVID-19 Every Worker Protection Act to direct @OSHA_DOL to establish an emergency standard to keep workers safe. https://t.co/CoCEOawpde

Our #EarthDay2020 celebration may look different this year but as we address the #ClimateCrisis & #COVID19 we must listen to the scientific community. The #ClimateCrisis is a health crisis - communities disproportionately exposed to pollution are facing severe #COVID19 symptoms.
This is a vital aspect of our coronavirus response and I will continue pushing for the additional resources our communities need.

We are anticipating a challenging wildfire season significant floods again this spring & an above average hurricane season. #COVID19 has stretched @fema's already thin resources & raises serious questions about the agency’s ability to respond to anticipated seasonal hazards. https://t.co/9Pdj2ox2YR

Many more households will need & likely qualify for assistance programs in the coming weeks and months. That's why I led 77 of my colleagues in calling for at least $4.3B for the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program in the next #COVID19 relief package https://t.co/7Nw8AnuYWC

As unemployment rates skyrocket during #COVID19 more families are struggling to pay their bills & we need to make sure that they still have access to basic utility services. I joined my colleagues in calling for a moratorium on shutoffs of electricity water heat & telecom https://t.co/ECMAGKlevF

As the coronavirus continues to spread it’s important to stay informed. This tool provides details about the situation in Oregon and across the country. You can find more information about available federal resources on my website.  https://t.co/GH71RZ4zwf

Dr. Francesca Dominici professor of biostatistics at Harvard briefed @ClimateCrisis on how long-term exposure to particulate matter affects respiratory & cardiovascular health exacerbates #COVID19 symptoms & increases risk of death. The #ClimateCrisis is a health crisis. https://t.co/D52hTB8if4

The #COVID19 pandemic has heightened the consequences of ignoring science. The Trump Admin is rolling back safeguards that reduce toxic mercury and other dangerous toxins in the air we breathe. @EPA needs to reevaluate its commitment to protecting public health & the environment. https://t.co/ShHF7GYGQL

Do you have questions about the protections that are available to student loan borrowers during the coronavirus pandemic? Tune into my webinar with @TICAS_org which is starting now! https://t.co/6JoOXwsC1q

Don’t forget: You can submit questions in advance for my webinar w/ @TICAS_org on help for student loan borrowers during the coronavirus pandemic. You join live at 5 p.m. tomorrow or watch a recording after. Submit questions & sign up to participate here: https://t.co/wJGAVDWw8d https://t.co/IL1oIF4aGj

Tonight I’ll be joining @JVP_MultCoD3 @JoAnnPDX @AndreaRSalinas and Dr. Jennifer Vines for a telephone town hall on COVID-19. I’ll be speaking about the challenges we’re facing with child care & what I’m doing to help.   Sign up to participate here: https://t.co/sIvZ8HtjUZ https://t.co/nOptRMRBPH

USPS helps keep us connected and offers services that are critical to the communities and businesses of Northwest Oregon. Its work is even more important during times of crisis and I will push for funding to #SaveThePostOffice in the next COVID-19 relief package.

COVID-19 is hitting communities of color harder because of systemic barriers to health care & other factors. We need to better understand what’s happening & fix it & better data will help. I will keep working to lift up the needs of underserved communities https://t.co/MYRlnhhNe9
Meet Dr. Kizzmekia Corbett the amazing scientist leading our effort to develop a coronavirus vaccine: https://t.co/FP9R882g3V

I’m advocating for student loan borrowers especially in the wake of COVID-19. Join me for a webinar this Wednesday with @TICAS_org about the tools that are available to help during this challenging time. Click here to RSVP and submit questions in advance: https://t.co/uPCYR8PzpY https://t.co/zTwneWoJMb
The unprecedented harm from the coronavirus pandemic requires an extraordinary response. This crucial funding will help stabilize our health care system in Oregon. https://t.co/KTNLhixsP7

I’m fighting for direct payments to help people pay for food rent utilities & other basic necessities during the #COVID19 pandemic. The IRS will begin distributing direct payments as early as next week but I know our work is not done.
Local efforts like the Oregon Worker Relief Fund help and I'll keep fighting to address these issues. COVID-19 19 does not discriminate and neither should assistance.

To respond to #COVID19 we must invest billions not millions in our workers and workforce system. @RepAndyLevin & I along with 49 of our colleagues are calling on House Leadership to provide at least $15.1B for our workforce system in the next recovery package. https://t.co/CWsdon1gF8
